intro: Licania sparsipilis, commonly known as the sparse-hair licania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in shaded environments. Licania sparsipilis is often found in rainforests and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils.
